fr.sii.ogham.testing.assertion.email

Class AssertEmail

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.testing.assertion.email.AssertEmail

  • public final class AssertEmail
extends Object
    Utility class for checking if the received email content is as expected.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(ExpectedMultiPartEmail expectedEmail,
                                javax.mail.Message actualEmail)
                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                IOException
        Assert that the fields of the received email are equal to the expected values. The expected email contains several parts (several contents). The received email should also have the equivalent parts. It will check that:
        • The received headers are respected (see assertHeaders(ExpectedEmailHeader, Message))
        • The received message is a Multipart email
        • The number of parts are equal
        • Each received part body equals the expected one (order is important). See assertBody(String, String, boolean)
        • Each received part Mime Type equals the expected one (order is important).

        The checking of the body is done strictly (totally equal).

        Parameters:
        expectedEmail - all the fields with their expected values
        actualEmail - the received email
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails
        IOException - when reading the content of the email fails

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(ExpectedMultiPartEmail expectedEmail,
                                javax.mail.Message[] actualEmails)
                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                IOException

        Shortcut to simplify unit testing with GreenMail. See assertEquals(ExpectedMultiPartEmail[], Message[]).

        Assert that the fields of the received email are equal to the expected values. The expected email contains several parts (several contents). The received email should also have the equivalent parts. It will check that:
        • The received headers are respected (see assertHeaders(ExpectedEmailHeader, Message))
        • The received message is a Multipart email
        • The number of parts are equal
        • Each received part body equals the expected one (order is important). See assertBody(String, String, boolean)
        • Each received part Mime Type equals the expected one (order is important).

        The checking of the body is done strictly (totally equal).

        Parameters:
        expectedEmail - all the fields with their expected values
        actualEmails - the received email
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails
        IOException - when reading the content of the email fails

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(ExpectedMultiPartEmail[] expectedEmails,
                                javax.mail.Message[] actualEmails)
                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                IOException
        Assert that each received email content respects the expected one. It ensures that the number of received emails equals to the expected number. Then for each email it calls assertEquals(ExpectedMultiPartEmail, Message) .
        Parameters:
        expectedEmails - the list of expected emails
        actualEmails - the received emails
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails
        IOException - when reading the content of the email fails

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(ExpectedEmail expectedEmail,
                                javax.mail.Message[] actualEmails)
                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                IOException

        Shortcut to simplify unit testing with GreenMail. See assertEquals(ExpectedEmail[], Message[]).

        Assert that the fields of the received email are equal to the expected values. The expected email contains only one part (only one content). It will check that:
        • The received headers are respected (see assertHeaders(ExpectedEmailHeader, Message))
        • The body equals the expected one (order is important). See assertBody(String, String, boolean)
        • The Mime Type equals the expected one (order is important).

        The checking of the body is done strictly (totally equal).

        Parameters:
        expectedEmail - all the fields with their expected values
        actualEmails - the received emails
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails
        IOException - when reading the email content fails

        actualEmails - the received emails
        Throws:

      • assertSimilar

        public static void assertSimilar(ExpectedMultiPartEmail expectedEmail,
                                 javax.mail.Message actualEmail)
                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                 IOException
        Assert that the fields of the received email are equal to the expected values. The expected email contains several parts (several contents). The received email should also have the equivalent parts. It will check that:
        • The received headers are respected (see assertHeaders(ExpectedEmailHeader, Message))
        • The received message is a Multipart email
        • The number of parts are equal
        • Each received part body equals the expected one (order is important). See assertBody(String, String, boolean)
        • Each received part Mime Type equals the expected one (order is important).

        The checking of the body ignores the new line characters.

        Parameters:
        expectedEmail - all the fields with their expected values
        actualEmail - the received email
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails
        IOException - when reading the content of the email fails

      • assertSimilar

        public static void assertSimilar(ExpectedMultiPartEmail[] expectedEmails,
                                 javax.mail.Message[] actualEmails)
                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                 IOException
        Assert that each received email content respects the expected one. It ensures that the number of received emails equals to the expected number. Then for each email it calls assertSimilar(ExpectedMultiPartEmail, Message) .
        Parameters:
        expectedEmails - the list of expected emails
        actualEmails - the received emails
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails

      • assertBody

        public static void assertBody(String expectedBody,
                              String actualBody,
                              boolean strict)
        Checks if the received body equals the expected body. It handles HTML content and pure text content.

        For text, the check can be done either strictly (totally equal) or not (ignore new lines).

        For HTML, the string content is parsed and DOM trees are compared. The comparison can be done either strictly (DOM trees are totally equals, attributes are in the same order) or not (attributes can be in any order).

        Parameters:
        expectedBody - the expected content as string
        actualBody - the received content as string
        strict - true for strict checking (totally equals) or false to ignore new line characters

      • assertHeaders

        public static void assertHeaders(ExpectedEmailHeader expectedEmail,
                                 javax.mail.Message actualEmail)
                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Checks if the received headers corresponds to the expected header values. It checks if:
        • The received subject equals the expected subject
        • The email sender address equals the expected sender address
        • The total number of recipients equals the total number of expected recipients
        • The number of "to" recipients equals the number of expected "to" recipients
        • The number of "cc" recipients equals the number of expected "cc" recipients
        • The number of "bcc" recipients equals the number of expected "bcc" recipients
        • Each "to" recipient equals the expected "to" recipient value
        • Each "cc" recipient equals the expected "cc" recipient value
        • Each "bcc" recipient equals the expected "bcc" recipient value
        Parameters:
        expectedEmail - the expected header values
        actualEmail - the received header values
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails

      • assertRecipients

        public static void assertRecipients(List<String> expectedRecipients,
                                    javax.mail.Message actualEmail,
                                    javax.mail.Message.RecipientType recipientType)
                             throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Checks if the received headers corresponds to the expected header values. It checks if:
        • The number of recipients of the provided type equals the number of expected recipients of the provided type
        • Each recipient of the provided type equals the expected recipient value of the provided type
        Parameters:
        expectedRecipients - the list of recipient string values
        actualEmail - the received header values
        recipientType - the type of the recipient to compare
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when accessing the received email fails
